milestone.title: v3.7.1
milestone.description:
This version is about to release with Cocos v2.3.2.
The core feature is Skeleton Animation support for Cocos Studio
It will provide Skeleton Animation for TimelineAction, its cpp/json parser, Lua/JS bindings,  web implementation.

data.body:
Set default 3d animation quality to low, which means do not interpolate between key frame, select the nearest instead.

It gets better performance.

data.title: Mechanism to pass event to lua is inconsistent
data.body:
- pass `update` event to lua

There is `Node::scheduleUpdateWithPriorityLua()`, so you can receive update event in lua like this

``` lua
local function update(dt)
...
end
sprite:scheduleUpdateWithPriorityLua(update, 0)
```
- pass `onEnter`, `onExit` event to lua

You should write like this in lua

``` lua
local function onNodeEvent(event)
...
end
someNode:registerScriptHandler(onNodeEvent)
```

`registerScriptHandler()` is not a member function of any Node, if you want to invoke this function on a Node, you should write lua-binding codes yourself.

Add functions in Node like `Node::scheduleUpdateWithPriorityLua()` is not a good idea. Write binding-codes for every Node that want to receive events is more bad.
